arm_group.description: Infants with culture confirmed GBS disease
Infants born to GBS colonized mother who do not develop GBS disease

biospec_descr.textblock: Maternal and cord serum aliquots will be retained.

brief_summary.textblock:
Feasibility phase for a study to evaluate antibody levels against Group B Streptococcus in
      mothers and their infants at delivery to establish antibody levels associated with
      reductions in risk of GBS disease in infants aged less than 90 days.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study Identifying Antibody Levels Associated With Reduced Risk of Invasive Group B Streptococcus Disease in Young Infants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        (i) Pregnant women attending antenatal clinic in one of the participating
        antenatal-clinics and/or delivering at one the participating delivery center.

        (ii) Subjects aged ≥18 years. (iii)  Able to understand and comply with planned study
        procedures. (iv) Provides written informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        (i) Refuses to consent to study participation.

study_pop.textblock:
Pregnant women aged 18 years or older attending for antenatal care or delivery at 1
        academic hospital centers in the Johannesburg area and the antenatal clinics serving that
        hospital centers.

facility.name: Respiratory and Meningeal Pathogen Research Unit

clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study for Identifying a Sero-correlate of Protection Against Invasive Group B Streptococcus Disease in Newborns and Young Infants Aged Less Than 90 Days.

oversight_info.authority: South African: South African Medicines Control Council

primary_outcome.description: To test key operational aspects of the proposed nested case control study to identify antibody levels associated with reduced risk of GBS disease in infants

primary_outcome.measure: Proposition maternal-infant dyads with maternal and cord collected.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Provide baseline population data on maternal GBS serotype distribution and anticapsular antibody levels
secondary_outcome.measure: GBS serotype distribution in subjects vaginally colonized with GBS at delivery.
Distribution of GBS anticapsular antibody concentrations (ser in subjects vaginally colonized with GBS at delivery.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
